item.title: Parking on pavement, 1st January
item.description:
Car totally parked on the pavement. Continuous illegal parking along Enfield highway. Pavements blocked. Cycle lanes blocked Pedestrians forced to walk in the road in some instances!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hertford Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extensive rubbish and Fly tipping, 1st January
item.description:
Loads of rubbish all over the lay-by in Whitewebbs Road for a distance of approx quarter mile including a wrecked abandoned caravan. Also rubbish dumped in the car parks within Whitewebbs woods. This is a perpetual and disgusting problem in this specific area. Could the Enfield Council install some sort of deterrence to at least reduce the mess e.g. cameras, (or even cheap dummy cameras) and anti litter notices.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitewebbs Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Modal filter sign facing wrong direction, 1st January
item.description:
The modal filter warning sign has been turned 180 degrees and is facing the wrong direction, so it provides no warning to drivers approaching the modal filter at the Old Dover Road / Langton Way junction.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delacourt Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Loads of rubbish bags spilling out, 1st January
item.description:
Rubbish dumped over time. Bags open and spilling out attracting more to be dump here. The irony is the sign on opposite side of road says dont dump rubbish here. Clearly someone has taken that to mean dump it elsewhere where. Danger of slipping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
